titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Seattle Pacific University Office of Business and Planning Records
1944-1998
Seattle Pacific University Office of Business and Planning Records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Adrienne Meier
titlestmt.sponsor: Funding for preparing this finding aid was provided through a grant awarded by the National Historical Publications and Records Commission.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-07-13
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

did.unittitle: Office of Business, Finance and Planning Records
did.abstract: The Seattle Pacific University Office of Business, Finance and Planning manages the legal and financial dealings of the University. This collection includes audit reports, building project files, Blakeley campus records, Casey campus records and a subject file.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes: financial records (Audit Reports approximately 1973-98, ledgers 1944-59, monthly finance reports 1954-67, and Seattle Pacific Foundation documents); building records (Oral V. Hemry files, Miller Science Learning Center records, 'HHFA' Student Union and other miscellaneous property assesments); and selected Blakeley campus records; Casey campus records; capital projects; NCATE accreditation files; NWASC file; Master Plan records; and a subject file.

accessrestrict.p: Some files in this collection are restricted. Contact the University Archivist for access.
